comment: I could've gotten away with not attending this class and still get an A. Was not a fan of the discussion based lectures but she did a good job explaining slides and the material was pretty easy. Homework assignment every week and exams are all online. Very sweet and managed the class well when we covered controversial topics with heated people.
She's great! loves to interact with students in class. Attendance is mandatory but it's worth it. Despite the huge class size she'll take time to answer your questions.

Dr. Larsen is very kind professor! I took her last summer in 2023 for her criminology course, while there are mandatory assignments and discussion boards to do, she is always kind enough to answer any questions you have and help you out. I took her online again for Socio 3380, and she was still amazing! Highly recommend her!

This was my 1st time taking Prof. Larsen for SOCI 2210 & I would take her again. I had her for an online course & will be taking her again in the Fall. provides amazing PP's & exam questions are from the PP. There's weekly discussions, but she makes them interesting. There is 2 Papers & Project. communicates w/ students & grades assignments fairly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class for soci 3380 great class. I have taken her class in the pass in person and a great professor and and outside of the class. She keeps you engaged and grades very fair. Just d

I took SOCI3380 with Carolee Larsen and it was a pretty straightforward class. Weekly discussion posts, 4 papers (3 are 5+ pages and 1 is 3+ pages), and 3 exams (no webcam). Stay on top of work and you'll do great! Would recommend!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Easy class. We just summarize what we learned in the chapter, every week for a grade, 3 tests for the semester, and exam (no lockdown all online). Although attendance is mandatory, if you miss a class you can view her slides online. She kept the class engaged, every discussion was a conversation between her and the class, in the lecture hall.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: Enjoyed going to this class because she encourages student engagement. Graded by one weekly quiz and one assignment. Attendance is mandatory!

Highly recommend her. Homework consists of reading & 2 end of week short assignments (one being 10 multiple choice, the other is a paragraph answer to a simulation relating to the hw's material). Tests are once a month but are easy if you study. Lectures are required but theyre fun and she is very sweet and handled a class of 200+ ppl very well.
Take her class. Attendance is mandatory but it was only twice a week. Quizzes and exams all online and not lockdown.

she was so sweet and great all tests and quizzes are online. She is super understanding so don't feel bad about reaching out. The class attendance is a grade but the convos are interesting 10000% would take again.

She loves student talking in class, and it makes the class so much more interesting. Attendance was a sheet of paper. Weekly online homework was basically the only work plus online tests. Such an easy class.

Amazing professor! Her lectures were very interactive and conversational with the class. She teaches the material in an easy to understand way. Tests were easy; straight out of the powerpoints, so make sure to study those! ATTENDANCE MATTERS! Weekly quizzes and a couple of discussions; nonetheless, a very manageable course! Definitely recommend her

She's become my favorite professor, Dr. Larson is so sweet and helpful! Weekly quiz/discussion board, theres 2 papers, and a final (career portfolio). Textbook readings & attendance matter, the guest speakers/events she had us attend were wonderful. Loved going to class because the lectures were fun, she really cares about her students and it shows

Dr Larsen is an amazing professor she really shows she cares about her students. She makes sure you understand the assignment and material. She works with you as long as you work with her. Overall, great professor highly recommend

Dr. Larsen is great at engaging with students and building meaningful connections with them. Her class is graded through easy weekly discussions and quizzes that were 5 questions. Then, there were only three big assignments that she gave a lot of time and assistance with. She is also willing to work with the class if they feel stressed!

Dr. Larsen is a great at making the classroom a community in the Professional Development course. She is really sweet so don't be afraid to ask her questions or email her and participating in class discussion will absolutely help with learning material rather than relying on the required textbooks. She is a detailed grader and gives good feedback!

Dr. Larsen was great, lectures were amazing and entertaining. Daily attendance and gave a few extra points if you didn't miss many classes. There were weekly quizzes w/ no more than 10 questions alongside of discussion post. You do have to read a bit, but it wasn't too heavy. You will need the textbooks. No final exam but 3 major assignments.

She's a good professor. She does take attendance and will call on randomly. You will have to sometime work in groups. Go to class for sure, because she even said "If you go to class I will help you out." She did indeed help me out. She can get a little off topic and things can turn a bit political and glimpse her views, but not awful.

Attendance is not required. Everything is in the textbook that she teaches in class. Do the discussion posts, chapter assignments, and tests and you'll get an A. Easy class. Took 33% hybrid. Recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Took her for Criminology and it was pretty simple and straightforward but you kind of have to teach yourself and the group projects have 0 outline. If you read the textbook and do the mindtap assignments you'll pass. Super sweet professor overall, literally gave someone a granola bar mid-class when the student had a headache.

Content is easy, however, I would not take this professor if you dislike/struggle with academic discipline and teaching yourself. Professor provides PowerPoint lectures, but the PowerPoints tend to be word-for-word from the textbook. Passed with an A without going to class.

One of my least favorite professors. She barely talks about the content in class and tends to ramble and waste class time. She has minimal, unclear grading criteria and refuses to give clarification when we ask. Complained about having to use a rubric. Was excited to take this class for interesting course material, but disappointed by the professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: My least favorite professor I have ever had. In person classes she doesn't talk about content at all, most people don't come. She would ask what we would like from her and when we respond she tells us we are wrong and disregards what we said. She is not very clear on what she expects from us and gets upset when we ask for more clarification.
This class was pretty easy, some quizzes and discussion posts. The final paper at the end was actually very simple and straightforward .

Definitely take Professor Larsen if you can! Sociology is a great course for many majors and she uploads a great amount of material, I recommend looking over everything before exams. Exams were mainly based on chapter ppts and hw. If you stay ahead and do everything on time you will be great, she is great at giving feedback and understanding you!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Larsen, has her course laid out nicely, considering the fast pace and abundance of information. She is kind, very responsive and cares about her students learning; she gives positive feedback and cares about her students. Very engaging.I took the online Summer II course. Opens the course. Clear grading criteria. Take her, and do the work!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The class was very interesting and fairly easy. Dr. Larsen is passionate about the subject and teaches in an effective way. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the class was enjoyable so I would always go. Assignments weren't very hard. Overall a fun and easy class!

Amazing class. If you have the chance you should definitely take her class. Her work is easy, but her actual class is amazing. Very engaging. She does not take attendance so you do not have to show up. I enjoyed her class and ended up with an A. She gives a lot of extra credit too!

Attendance was never taken, so I stopped going to her class once I realized that everything was posted on D2L weekly. Her class was mainly her just reading a few things off the PowerPoint and having class discussions. As long as you do the assignments and Cengage weekly and the tests (online) you'll pass. Easy A.

Prof Larsen doesn't take attendance so I literally never went to class yet I didn't miss anything bc she posts announcements to d2l. She's a pretty easy grader and there isn't too many assignments. I took juvenile justice and criminology with her and would recommend for an easy A

Her class is a easy A if you do the hw every week and the test are pretty easy. Her. class is pretty boring because she mostly read stuff off the powerpoint. Her class does get interesting if the class have a discussion on a topic. Even her class is easy I would think about if I want to take her again bc that class was boring...

The class was so boring and impossible to stay focused in. Few people talked here and there but was just boring. Homework assignments were pretty easy, but the tests are so difficult. Test scores alone will bring down your grade hard.

She is super sweet and has really interesting lectures! Attendance isnt mandatory and all you do is a weekly assignment on mindtap. So easy, ended the class with a 100. Take this class if you want a no stress class:)

I took Professor Larsen last year for SOCI 1101 and had no issues. This year, I have her for SOCI 4432 and cant get out of class fast enough. Attendance in my class has gone from 15 students to 9. She is constantly off topic and never talks about what is on the PowerPoint. She brings up COVID every single class and masks are required only for her.

All of our weekly assignments were on Mindtap. You have three every week including a 20 question quiz. The textbook is an easy read and lectures are very fun and open. She is really kind and will help you outside of class. We had one paper and weeks to prepare for it. Lectures were held in class and on Zoom.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: She is a very sweet teacher. No lockdown. Not that much homework. Her class is very easy to take!

Dr. Larsen is a great professor and the course was in easy A. Information gets a bit redundant. Discussion boards weekly, chapter readings and quizzes every other week, and four (subjective) reading assignments. Youre gonna need to buy moonshot and its cheapest on Apple Books.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Not a bad class at all! I liked the material a lot and the way she organized the class, but I didn't feel any different after I finished it. She doesn't allow you to go back to previous questions on tests, so you have to lock in your answer and move on. I made Bs on 2 tests because I rushed, so please take your time! She gives you 1 hour for 25Qs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Larsen is very nice! She assigns a chapter to read along with a 10 question quiz, a 5 question analysis quiz, and a discussion post every week. Quizlet will be your best friend! This class was asynchronous, so everything was due at the end of the week. Took me abt an hour to complete all the work. Take this class if you want an easy A!

Not a bad professor for this class. There are weekly assignments in the online book due every Sunday, and discussions every Monday. A test without webcam or lockdown every few weeks. I honestly didn't learn much, just did assignments(maybe cause online class).But it wasn't difficult.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took this class online for a spring semester and loved it. Professor Larsen gave good feedback. There was a discussion every week and a quiz on cengage. only a few tests and one final none are on a lockdown browser. most answers are on the powerpoints, and you can use notes for your tests.

The rating she has is unfair. Great professor, very straight forward, all the material is easily accessible. Textbook is provided in PDF format. Took me less than an hour a week to complete the assignments due for the week. Extremely easy A, would definitely take her again.

TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. She is a very straight forward professor and you wil likely end with an A. There is weekly reading with 2 quizzes, and 1 discussion board post. Only 4 tests. The quizzes are hard but if you at least read vocab words you will be fine. Grades for completion on discussion board and quizzes and tests come straight from reading.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class is lecture heavy but she does not lecture, she lets the students lecture. There is heavy reading but she does give you time to catch up on the reading if necessary. There is also a lot of writing but what do you expect from an upper course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best professors I've had at KSU in my four years. She is extremely compassionate about the course materials. The class requires a lot of reading but they are all interesting. If you ever need help she's more than willing.
This is my second class with her and she is so organized! She sometimes makes things sound harder than they are, but then is a really easy grader. Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I took her online class and it was very easy to follow. If you read the book, all of the assignments are easy. Weekly assignments that are very organized, you'll never be confused about what is due. Super easy and no lockdown browsers fyi.

She was fine I guess and so was the class, but I just attended class because she had a sign up sheet and if you missed like 4 classes you failed. Her lectures were boring and she always went way off topic so I wouldn't pay attention. The homework was easy and online so DO IT! The tests were also online so I wouldn't waste too much time studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice and caring. Bumped me from a 74 to an 80. One of the few reasons I kept going to university and eventually got better. There was busy work and sometimes the class got derailed but overall a great professor and a good option for people who have to take KSU 1101.

Taking this class was the biggest mistake of my life I thought it would be helpful to take a first year seminar because I wanted to be surrounded by people who were in the same boat as me but, instead all I got was TOO MUCH busy work She can talk about nothing for hours Her goal was to help us like college but, I wanted to drop out bc of this class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a very boring teacher. The class would have been a lot better if she knew what she was talking about. It seemed like she came in each day and had no idea what she was going to talk about until she saw the powerpoint again. I took this class as a requirement for my major and i would not continue into any sociology classes after taking this.

She is an amazing professor. Very caring for her students and always making sure everyone is on track. Her assignments are online and due once a week, so it is easy to stay on track. If you stay on track with those it will be an easy A, but attendance is what she is strict about- cant miss 3. She is very funny and gives good lectures so its good

Dr. Larsen is super kind and laid back. It's a super easy class, but she likes participation and takes attendance. There's a few small homework assignments that are easy, and two big projects that are "fun" and "easy." Highly recommend for the uni requirement.

Easiest A you can get your first year. Really laid back, the homework she rarely assigns is super easy. A lot of my friends took KSU 1101 and said their teachers made them do a lot, but not with my teacher. Couple of projects, again super easy and quick to do. Really only showed up for attendance (she takes it every class).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I loved her so much lol she's so funny. Yeah she takes attendance but I took a hybrid and only had her once a week. This class was too easy. A lot of busy work but she's not a tough grader at all. Like pretty much everything seemed like completion grades.

Great professor. I did hybrid and mostly everything was online. Very easy. Usually grades assignments pretty fast and easy. Laid back and chill. Make sure you participate in class when she asks questions. Takes attendance. Cancels class every once in awhile to give us work days. Overall great :)

I really enjoyed being in Professor Larsen's class. She taught me a lot of useful information and is a very funny person. She really cares for her students and comes into class each day asking how we all are doing.

Dr. Larsen is a good teacher but she will frequently repeat what she has said and ramble on a lot. She assigns lots of projects. It's one project after another and sometimes its 3 projects all at once so get ready to work. Attendance is mandatory she will take off 10 points off your final grade if you miss more than 3 classes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Not a fun class

Professor Larsen is a great person. She is a caring and funny person, and although she had to go by the PowerPoint made for her by the honors college, she put her own twist on it and she is really great. You should definitely take her.
There is a lot of work for just a seminar class but she makes it fun and not boring. She may be a little crazy but I learned many things from her as a person not just from the class materials.

You have to work your tail off to get an A.  While the class is not "hard," it requires a ton of work.  You have a huge group project and she gives you so many essays to write.  Final exam is 3- 5 page essay plus a 2 page essay on the course.  Way too much work for a required ksu class.  I have less work in my composition class.

This class was not an easy A like expected for a seminar class. Her tests are tough but lets you create the essay questions. Expect to read the textbook if you don't you won't pass. There is also a group project that's worth 400 points of your overall 1000 point grade. Lots of class discussions.
very easy class and nice teacher.
Dr. Larsen is a great teacher! Even though the class itself is boring, she tries to make it as enjoyable as possible. Her class is EXTREMELY easy as well. TAKE HER!!
she is awesome, and really chill, learned alot!

Professor Larson's class was extremely EASY!!!!! Take this freshmen class for sure! Her tests are online and she is very helpful. She is definitely there to see you succeed. She keeps her lectures light and fun, even if they are sort of pointless. I really did not love the course, but its required. Easy A!

Never used a text book. Mrs. Larsen is a great and super laid back teacher. Anyone who says she is bad only means the class. The class itself is super pointless but she is a great teacher who makes it bearable and WAY easy. Practically never use the workbook. I took the hybrid class. TAKE HYBRID!
okay

Boring class, but very easy. I took this as a hybrid and there was very little work involved. She is very nice and willing to try different activities. She tends to get off tangent a lot, but this class is very easy, especially for a freshman.
BAD.
Great teacher. I commute and she worked with me to work around certain issues. Great teacher. Super fun class and super easy.
